intro: Gomphocarpus amabilis, commonly known as the sweet milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Gomphocarpus amabilis is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
